article.headline: Snap stock heads for highest close in more than three years amid longest win streak on record
article.body: Shares of Snap Inc. SNAP, -0.18% are up 2.2% in Tuesday trading and on track for their highest close since March 27, 2017, when the stock ended the session at $23.83. Snap shares recently changed hands at $23.70. The stock is on pace for its longest winning streak on record if the gains hold through the close, which would make for the eighth-straight trading day of stock-price increases for Snap, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The company is planning its first "shoppable" show called "The Drop," according to a Variety report, which said that the original show will focus on streetwear. Snap shares have rallied 122% over the past three months as the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% has gained 41%.
